channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: OpenAI is now worth more than 87% of S&P 500 companies. It faces a tough test ahead.

item.title: Oil shock? How OPEC+ could soften the blow if the Middle East conflict hits supply.
item.description: The market has a not-so-secret cushion should Israel target Iran’s oil industry.

item.title: Costco now sells platinum bars — but some financial pros say they aren’t a sure bet
item.description: When it comes to precious metals, gold is still often all that glitters, experts say.

item.title: Oil Rises On Concerns Over Supply Disruptions
item.description: Oil gained. ANZ Research analysts said there were fears of oil supply disruptions following a news report that Israel is considering a missile attack ...

item.title: Gold Edges Higher in Likely Technical Recovery
item.description: Gold edged higher in early Asian trade in a likely technical recovery.

item.title: Levi’s tempers forecast and weighs sale of Dockers — ‘This is all about focus,’ CEO says

item.title: Bank of America customers report outage, with some seeing $0 balances in their accounts

item.title: Most JGBs Edge Lower, Tracking U.S. Treasurys Losses
item.description: Most JGBs edged lower in the morning Tokyo session, tracking overnight price losses of U.S. Treasurys and reversing Wednesday’s JGB price gains.

item.title: People Without Kids Are Leaving Money to Surprised Heirs
item.description: The bequests benefit charities, distant relatives and even pets.
